Utils

Class LinearScale2

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utils.LinearScale2

  • public class LinearScale2
extends java.lang.Object
    LinearScale is a common math object that easily computes linear scales in 2D. Computes Y from X with the following relation : Y = (A * X) + B, where all symbols are Vector2.
    Since:
    2.0

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] Scale(double x, double y)
      Alias : Scale
      Vector Scale(Vector X)
      Computes and return the scaled vector : Y = (A * X) + B
      Vector[] Scale(Vector[] xArray)
      Computes and return the scaled vector : Y = (A * X) + B for each vector in the given array
      java.lang.String toString()
      Return a readable string which contains A and B vectors.

      • Scale

        public Vector[] Scale(Vector[] xArray)
        Computes and return the scaled vector : Y = (A * X) + B for each vector in the given array

        Returns:
        The array of scaled vectors
